Title: 07 - Glueing 2D Shapes to 2D Shapes
Tip: 2D Glue requires the shape to reference another. But this can be dynamically using a function that contains a reference to the target.

Summary.What: When the target shape is moved, the source shape must adjust to stay connected.
Summary.Why: 1D shapes must adjust there soze and orientation to stay connected in the diagram.
Summary.How: The function is executed as part of the source shapes render cycle.

Samples.Tip: 2D Glue is a direct rewrite of the ContextLink function.
Samples.Title: 2D Glue on a shape

Samples.Tip: 2D Glue can also adjust the any attribute of the source shape.
